intro: Polycarena hispidula, commonly known as the hairy polycarena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes grass-like plants and some aquatic species. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in swampy areas or along riverbanks. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists studying wetland flora.
